'''Advice to stop''' : All healthcare professionals must suggest stopping (5A) at every consultation:

# Ask: ask if the person smokes
# Assess: assess their smoking habits
# Advise: advise each smoker to stop smoking
# Assist: discuss the range of aids and support available to help them achieve this goal
# Arrange: offer written information to support this advice

Motivational interviewing

A patient-centred relational approach, the aim of which is to arouse or reinforce the patient's motivation to change, in order to help them change their behaviour.

question.title: What is the primary aim of Motivational Interviewing?
question.description: A patient-centred relational approach to help patients change their behaviour

option_a.title: To provide a range of aids and support to help patients quit smoking
option_a.description: A healthcare professional's role in smoking cessation

option_b.title: To assess a patient's smoking habits and provide written information
option_b.description: A healthcare professional's role in smoking cessation

option_c.title: To help patients change their behaviour through a patient-centred relational approach
option_c.description: The primary aim of Motivational Interviewing

option_d.title: To recommend a specific cessation aid to each patient
option_d.description: A healthcare professional's role in smoking cessation
